3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		main.c						     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	The main routine of Tcl Modules including all of     **
15   |  **			the global data.				     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		main		Main program			     **
18   |  **			module_usage	Module usage information	     **
19   |  **			Tcl_AppInit	Tcl Application initialization	     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  **   Notes:								     **
22   |  ** 									     **
23   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
24   |  ****/
25   | 
26   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
27   |  ** 									     **
28   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
29   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **

33   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: main.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:35 rkowen Exp $";
34   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
35   | 
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
38   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
39   | 
40   | #include "modules_def.h"
41   | #include "getopt.h"
42   | 
43   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
44   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | 
47   | /** not applicable **/
48   | 
49   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | 
53   | /** not applicable **/
54   | 
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | /** 				    COMMON STRINGS			     **/
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | 
59   | /* TRANSLATORS: The next five are the common strings */
60   | char	em_reading[]	= N_("reading");
61   | char	em_writing[]	= N_("writing");
62   | char	em_appending[]	= N_("appending");
63   | char	em_read_write[]	= N_("read/write");
64   | char	em_unknown[]	= N_("unknown");
65   | /* TRANSLATORS: id string for default versions */
66   | char	em_default[]	= N_("default"); 
67   | 
68   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
69   | /** 				    GLOBAL DATA				     **/
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | 
72   | char	 *g_current_module = NULL,	/** The module which is handled by   **/
73   | 					/** the current command		     **/
74   | 	 *g_specified_module = NULL,	/** The module that was specified    **/
75   | 					/** on the command line		     **/
76   | 	 *g_module_path = NULL,		/** The path to the module	     **/
77   | 	 *shell_name,			/** Name of the shell		     **/
78   | 					/** (first parameter to modulcmd)    **/
79   | 	 *shell_derelict,		/** Shell family (sh, csh, etc)	     **/
80   | 	 *shell_init,			/** Shell init script name	     **/
81   | 	 *shell_cmd_separator,		/** Shell command separator char     **/
82   | 	  _colon[] = ":";		/** directory separator		     **/
83   | int	  g_flags = 0,			/** Control what to do at the moment **/
84   | 					/** The posible values are defined in**/
85   | 					/** module_def.h		     **/
86   | 	  g_retval = 0,			/** exit return value		     **/
87   | 	  g_output = 0,			/** Has output been generated	     **/
88   | 	  append_flag = 0;		/** only used by the 'use' command   **/
89   | 
90   | /**
91   |  **  Name of the rc files
92   |  **  PREFIX points to the location where modules is going to be installed.
93   |  **  It comes from the Makefile
94   |  **/
95   | 
96   | char	*instpath = PREFIX,
97   | 	*rc_file = RCFILE,
98   | 	*modulerc_file = MODULERCFILE,
99   | 	*version_file = VERSIONFILE;
100  | 
101  | /**
102  |  **  pointers for regular expression evaluations
103  |  **/
104  | char
105  |     *addRE      = "^(add|load)", 		/** 'module add <file>'	     **/
106  |     *rmRE       = "^(rm|del|era|remov|unload)",	/** 'module unload <file>'   **/
107  |     *swRE       = "^sw",			/** 'module switch <file>'   **/
108  |     *dispRE     = "^(disp|show)", 		/** 'module display <file>'  **/
109  |     *listRE     = "^li", 			/** 'module list <file>'     **/
110  |     *availRE    = "^av",			/** 'module avail <file>'    **/
111  |     *helpRE     = "^(help|\\?)",		/** 'module help <file>'     **/
112  |     *initRE     = "^init",			/** 'module init'	     **/
113  |     *useRE      = "^use",			/** 'module use <file>'	     **/
114  |     *unuseRE    = "^unuse",			/** 'module unuse <file>'    **/
115  |     *updateRE   = "^update",			/** 'module update'	     **/
116  |     *purgeRE    = "^purge",			/** 'module purge'	     **/
117  |     *clearRE    = "^clear",			/** 'module clear'	     **/
118  |     *whatisRE   = "^wh",			/** 'module whatis'	     **/
119  |     *aproposRE  = "^(apr|key)",			/** 'module apropos'	     **/
120  |     *refreshRE  = "^refr";			/** 'module refresh'	     **/
121  |   
122  | /**
123  |  **  Hash-Tables for all changes to the environment.
124  |  **/
125  | 
126  | MHash		*setenvHashTable,
127  | 		*unsetenvHashTable,
128  | 		*aliasSetHashTable,
129  | 		*aliasUnsetHashTable,
130  | 		*markVariableHashTable,
131  | 		*markAliasHashTable;
132  | 
133  | MHash		*GlobalHashTables[5];
134  | 
135  | /**
136  |  **  A buffer for reading a single line
137  |  **/
138  | 
139  | char	*line = NULL;
140  | 
141  | /**
142  |  **  Flags influenced by the command line switches
143  |  **/
144  | 
145  | int	sw_force = 0,
146  | 	sw_detach = 0,
147  | 	sw_format = 0,
148  | 	sw_verbose = 0,
149  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_ADVANCED,
150  | 	sw_icase = 0;
151  | 
152  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
153  | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
154  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
155  | 
156  | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
157  | 
158  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
159  | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
160  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
161  | 
162  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[]);
163  | static void	version (FILE *output);
164  | 
165  | /*++++
166  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
167  |  ** 									     **
168  |  **   Function:		main						     **
169  |  ** 									     **
170  |  **   Description:	Main program					     **
171  |  ** 									     **
172  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
173  |  ** 									     **
174  |  **   Parameters:	int	argc		Number of parameters	     **
175  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
176  |  **			char	*environ[]	Pointer to the process' en-  **
177  |  **						vironment.		     **
178  |  **   Result:		int	1		Usage information printed    **
179  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
180  |  **				other		Return value of the module   **
181  |  **			 			subcomand		     **
182  |  ** 									     **
183  |  **   Attached Globals:	*Ptr	 	by Initialize_Module		     **
184  |  **			*HashTable	by Initialize_Module	 	     **
185  |  ** 									     **
186  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
187  |  ++++*/
188  | 
189  | int	main( int argc, char *argv[], char *environ[]) {
190  | 
191  |     Tcl_Interp	*interp;
192  |     int          return_val = 0;
193  |     char	*rc_name;
194  |     char	*rc_path;
195  | 	Tcl_Obj       **objv;		/** Tcl Object vector **/
196  | 	int             objc;		/** Tcl Object vector count **/
197  | 
198  | #ifdef HAVE_SETLOCALE
199  | 	/* set local via LC_ALL */
200  | 	setlocale(LC_ALL,"");
201  | #endif
202  | 
203  | #if ENABLE_NLS
204  | 	/* the text message domain. */
205  | 	bindtextdomain(PACKAGE, LOCALEDIR);
206  | 	textdomain(PACKAGE);
207  | #endif
208  | 
209  |     /**
210  |      ** check if first argument is --version or -V then output the
211  |      ** version to stdout.  This is a special circumstance handled
212  |      ** by the regular options.
213  |      **/
214  |     if (argc > 1 && *argv[1] == '-') {
215  |         if (!strcmp("-V", argv[1]) || !strcmp("--version", argv[1])) {
216  | 	    version(stdout);
217  | 	    return 0;
218  |         }
219  |     }
220  |     /**
221  |      **  Initialization. 
222  |      **  Check the command line syntax. There will be no return from the
223  |      **  initialization function in case of invalid command line arguments.
224  |      **/
225  |     if( TCL_OK != Initialize_Module( &interp, argc, argv, environ))
226  | 	goto unwind0;
227  | 
228  |     if( TCL_OK != Setup_Environment( interp))
229  | 	goto unwind0;
230  | 
231  |     /**
232  |      **  Check for command line switches
233  |      **/
234  | 
235  |     if( TCL_OK != Check_Switches( &argc, argv))
236  | 	goto unwind0;
237  | 
238  |     /**
239  |      **  Figure out, which global RC file to use. This depends on the environ-
240  |      **  ment variable 'MODULERCFILE', which can be set to one of the following:
241  |      **
242  |      **		<filename>	-->	PREFIX/etc/<filename>
243  |      **		<dir>/		-->	<dir>/RC_FILE
244  |      **		<dir>/<file>	-->	<dir>/<file>
245  |      **  Use xgetenv to expand 1 level of env.vars.
246  |      **/
247  | 
248  |     if((rc_name = xgetenv( "MODULERCFILE"))) {
249  | 	/* found something in MODULERCFILE */
250  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0,rc_name,NULL))) {
251  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
252  | 		goto unwind1;
253  | 	    else
254  | 		null_free((void *) &rc_name);
255  | 	} else {
256  | 	    null_free((void *) &rc_name);
257  | 	    if((char *) NULL == (rc_name = strrchr( rc_path, '/'))) {
258  | 		rc_name = rc_path;
259  | 		rc_path = instpath;
260  | 	    } else
261  | 		*rc_name++ = '\0';
262  | 	    if( !*rc_name) {
263  | 		rc_name = rc_file;
264  | 	    }
265  | 	}
266  |     } else {
267  | 	rc_path = instpath;
268  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_name);
269  | 	rc_name = rc_file;
270  |     }
271  | 
272  |     /**
273  |      **  Finally we have to change PREFIX -> PREFIX/etc
274  |      **/
275  | 
276  |     if( rc_path == instpath) {
277  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0, instpath,"/etc",NULL))){
278  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
279  | 		goto unwind1;
280  | 	    else
281  | 		rc_path = NULL;
282  | 	
283  | 	}
284  |     }
285  | 
286  |     /**
287  |      **  Source the global and the user defined RC file
288  |      **/
289  | 
290  |     g_current_module = (char *) NULL;
291  | 
292  |     if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, rc_path, rc_name) ||
293  | 	TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, getenv( "HOME"), modulerc_file))
294  | 	exit( 1);
295  | 
296  |     if( rc_path)
297  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_path);
298  | 
299  |     /**
300  |      **  Invocation of the module command as specified in the command line
301  |      **/
302  | 
303  |     g_flags = 0;
304  |     Tcl_ArgvToObjv(&objc, &objv, argc-1, argv+1);
305  |     return_val = cmdModule((ClientData) 0,interp,objc, objv);
306  | 
307  |     /**
308  |      **  If we were doing some operation that has already flushed its output,
309  |      **  then we don't need to re-flush the output here.
310  |      **
311  |      **  Also, if we've had an error here, then the whole modulecmd failed
312  |      **  and not just the values for a single modulefile.  So, we'll pass in
313  |      **  a NULL here to indicate that any error message should say that
314  |      **  absolutely NO changes were made to the environment.
315  |      **/
316  | 
317  |     if( TCL_OK == return_val) {
318  | 	Output_Modulefile_Changes( interp);
319  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
320  | 	xresourceFinish( 1);
321  | #endif
322  |     } else {
323  | 	Unwind_Modulefile_Changes( interp, NULL);
324  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
325  | 	xresourceFinish( 0);
326  | #endif
327  |     }
328  | 
329  |     /**
330  |      **  Finally clean up. Delete the required hash tables and conditionally
331  |      **  allocated areas.
332  |      **/
333  | 
334  |     Global_Hash_Tables(GHashDelete, NULL);
335  | 
336  |     if( line)
337  | 	null_free((void *) &line);
338  |     if( error_line)
339  | 	null_free((void *) &error_line);
340  | 
341  |     /**
342  |      **  This return value may be evaluated by the calling shell
343  |      **/
344  |     OutputExit();
345  |     return ( return_val ? return_val : g_retval);
346  | 
347  | /* unwind2:
348  |     null_free((void *) &rc_path); */
349  | unwind1:
350  |     null_free((void *) &rc_name);
351  | unwind0:
352  | 
353  |     /* and error occurred of some type */
354  |     g_retval = (g_retval ? g_retval : 1);
355  |     OutputExit();
356  |     return (g_retval);
357  | 
358  | } /** End of 'main' **/
359  | 
360  | /*++++
361  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
362  |  ** 									     **
363  |  **   Function:		module_usage					     **
364  |  ** 									     **
365  |  **   Description:	Lists out the helpful usage info that we've all come **
366  |  ** 			to expect from unix commands.			     **
367  |  ** 									     **
368  |  **   First Edition:	2002/10/13					     **
369  |  ** 									     **
370  |  **   Parameters:	FILE	*output		Where the output goes	     **
371  |  ** 									     **
372  |  **   Result:		void			No return values	     **
373  |  ** 									     **
374  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
375  |  ** 			version_string		Current module version	     **
376  |  ** 			date_string		Current module date	     **
377  |  ** 									     **
378  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
379  |  ++++*/
380  | 
381  | void module_usage(FILE *output)
382  | {
383  |     /**
384  |      **  General help wanted.
385  |      **/
386  | 	fprintf(output,
387  | 		_("\n  Modules Release %s %s (Copyright GNU GPL v2 1991):\n\n"),
388  |                 version_string,date_string);
389  | 	
390  | 	fprintf(output,
391  | /* TRANSLATORS: keep the options and formatting the same */
392  | _(
393  | "  Usage: module [ switches ] [ subcommand ] [subcommand-args ]\n\n"
394  | "Switches:\n"
395  | "	-H|--help		this usage info\n"
396  | "	-V|--version		modules version & configuration options\n"
397  | "	-f|--force		force active dependency resolution\n"
398  | "	-t|--terse		terse    format avail and list format\n"
399  | "	-l|--long		long     format avail and list format\n"
400  | "	-h|--human		readable format avail and list format\n"
401  | "	-v|--verbose		enable  verbose messages\n"
402  | "	-s|--silent		disable verbose messages\n"
403  | "	-i|--icase		case insensitive\n"
404  | "	-u|--userlvl <lvl>	set user level to (nov[ice],exp[ert],adv[anced])\n"
405  | "  Available SubCommands and Args:\n"
406  | "	+ add|load		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
407  | "	+ rm|unload		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
408  | "	+ switch|swap		[modulefile1] modulefile2\n"
409  | "	+ display|show		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
410  | "	+ avail			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
411  | "	+ use [-a|--append]	dir [dir ...]\n"
412  | "	+ unuse			dir [dir ...]\n"));
413  | #ifdef BEGINENV
414  | 	fprintf(output,_(
415  | "	+ update\n"));
416  | #endif
417  | 	fprintf(output,_(
418  | "	+ refresh\n"
419  | "	+ purge\n"
420  | "	+ list\n"
421  | "	+ clear\n"
422  | "	+ help			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
423  | "	+ whatis		[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
424  | "	+ apropos|keyword	string\n"
425  | "	+ initadd		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
426  | "	+ initprepend		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
427  | "	+ initrm		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
428  | "	+ initswitch		modulefile1 modulefile2\n"
429  | "	+ initlist\n"
430  | "	+ initclear\n\n"));
431  | 
432  | } /** End of 'module_usage' **/
433  | 
434  | /*++++
435  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
436  |  ** 									     **
437  |  **   Function:		Tcl_AppInit					     **
438  |  ** 									     **
439  |  **   Description:	This is needed if you use shared TCL libraries.	     **
440  |  **			It won't be called, but the linker complains if it   **
441  |  **		   	doesn't exist.					     **
442  |  ** 									     **
443  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
444  |  ** 									     **
445  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter to   **
446  |  **							be initialized	     **
447  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Initialization succ. **
448  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
449  |  ** 									     **
450  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
451  |  ++++*/
452  | 
453  | int Tcl_AppInit(Tcl_Interp *interp)
454  | {
455  |     return( TCL_OK);
456  | 
457  | } /** End of 'Tcl_AppInit' **/
458  | 
459  | /*++++
460  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
461  |  ** 									     **
462  |  **   Function:		Check_Switches					     **
463  |  ** 									     **
464  |  **   Description:	Check for command line switches and set internal     **
465  |  **			control variable according to them. Command line     **
466  |  **			switches are defined to appear between the shell and **
467  |  **			the module command. They begin on a dash and may     **
468  |  **			appear in long and short format. 		     **
469  |  **									     **
470  |  **			The following switches are defined:		     **
471  |  **									     **
472  |  **			    --force, -f		Force prerequired actions    **
473  |  **			    --terse, -t		Terse, parseable messages    **
474  |  **			    --human, -h		Human readable form          **
475  |  **			    --long, -l		Long messages		     **
476  |  **			    --verbose, -v	Verbose mode on		     **
477  |  **			    --silent, -s	Verbose mode off	     **
478  |  **			    --userlvl, -u	Change the user level	     **
479  |  **			    --icase, -i		Ignore case of modulefile    **
480  |  **						names			     **
481  |  **			    --help, -H		Helpful usage info	     **
482  |  **			    --version, -V	Report version only	     **
483  |  ** 									     **
484  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/20					     **
485  |  ** 									     **
486  |  **   Parameters:	int	*argc		Number of parameters	     **
487  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
488  |  **									     **
489  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
490  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Unknown switch found	     **
491  |  **			*argc, *argv		All switches are removed     **
492  |  **						from the argv vector	     **
493  |  ** 									     **
494  |  **   Attached Globals:	sw_force		--force, -f		     **
495  |  **			sw_format		-t, -l, -h, -p               **
496  |  **			sw_verbose		--verbose, -v, --silent, -s  **
497  |  **			sw_userlvl		--userlvl, -u		     **
498  |  **			sw_icase		--icase, -i		     **
499  |  ** 									     **
500  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
501  |  ++++*/
502  | 
503  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[])
504  | {
505  | 
506  |     int c;
507  | 
508  |     /**
509  |      **  These are the options we do provide
510  |      **/
511  | 
512  |     const struct option longopts[] = {
513  | 	{ "force", no_argument, NULL, 'f' },
514  | 	{ "terse", no_argument, NULL, 't' },
515  | 	{ "long", no_argument, NULL, 'l' },
516  | 	{ "human", no_argument, NULL, 'h' },
517  | 	{ "parseable", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
518  | 	{ "parse", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
519  | 	{ "verbose", no_argument, NULL, 'v' },
520  | 	{ "silent", no_argument, NULL, 's' },
521  | 	{ "icase", no_argument, NULL, 'i' },
522  | 	{ "userlvl", required_argument, NULL, 'u'},
523  | 	{ "append", no_argument, NULL, 'a' },
524  | 	{ "help", no_argument, NULL, 'H' },
525  | 	{ "version", no_argument, NULL, 'V' },
526  | 	{ NULL, no_argument, NULL, 0 }
527  |     };
528  | 
529  |     /**
530  |      **  Scan the command line for options defined in the longopt table.
531  |      **  Skip the very first argument, which is the shell to be used
532  |      **/
533  |     if( *argc > 1) {
534  | 
535  | 	while( EOF != (c = getopt_long( *argc-1, &argv[1], "hpftlvsciu:aHV",
536  | 	    longopts, NULL))) {
537  | 
538  | 	    switch( c) {
539  | 
540  | 		/**
541  | 		 **  Force
542  | 		 **/
543  | 
544  | 		case 'f':			/* force */
545  | 		    sw_force = 1;
546  | 		    break;
547  | 
548  | 		/**
549  | 		 **  Format of the messages
550  | 		 **/
551  | 
552  | 		case 't':			/* terse */
553  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_TERSE);
554  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_LONG;
555  | 		    break;
556  | 
557  | 		case 'l':			/* long */
558  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_LONG);
559  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_TERSE;
560  | 		    break;
561  | 
562  | 		case 'h':			/* human */
563  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_HUMAN);
564  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_PARSE;
565  | 		    break;
566  | 
567  | 		case 'p':			/* parseable */
568  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_PARSE);
569  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_HUMAN;
570  | 		    break;
571  | 
572  | 		/**
573  | 		 **  Verbosity
574  | 		 **/
575  | 
576  | 		case 'v':			/* verbose */
577  | 		    sw_verbose = 1;
578  | 		    break;
579  | 
580  | 		case 's':			/* silent */
581  | 		    sw_detach = 1;
582  | 		    break;
583  | 
584  | 		/**
585  | 		 **  Locating
586  | 		 **/
587  | 
588  | 		case 'i':			/* icase */
589  | 		    sw_icase = 1;
590  | 		    break;
591  | 
592  | 		/**
593  | 		 **  The user level comes as a string argument to the -u option
594  | 		 **/
595  | 
596  | 		case 'u':			/* userlvl */
597  | 		    cmdModuleUser_sub( optarg);
598  | 		    break;
599  | 
600  | 		/**
601  | 		 **  a special purpose flag for 'use' only
602  | 		 **/
603  | 		case 'a':			/* --append */
604  | 		    append_flag = 1;
605  | 		    break;
606  | 
607  | 		case 'H':			/* helpful info */
608  | 		    module_usage(stderr);
609  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
610  | 
611  | 		case 'V':			/* version */
612  | 		    version(stderr);
613  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
614  | 
615  | 		/**
616  | 		 **  All remaining options will influence their flags as defined
617  | 		 **  in the optlong table above.
618  | 		 **/
619  | 
620  | 		case 0:
621  | 		    break;
622  | 
623  | 		/**
624  | 		 **  Error messages for unknown options will be printed by
625  | 		 **  getopt ...
626  | 		 **/
627  | 
628  | 		case '?':
629  | 		    break;
630  | 
631  | 		/**
632  | 		 **  Well, this seems to be an internal error
633  | 		 **/
634  | 
635  | 		default:
636  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_GETOPT, LOC, NULL))
637  | 			return( TCL_ERROR);	/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ----> **/
638  | 		    break;
639  | 
640  | 	    }  /** switch() **/
641  | 	}  /** while() **/
642  |     } /** if( argc) **/
643  | 
644  |     /**
645  |      **  Special things to be dine for the 'silent' option: Pipe stderr
646  |      **  output to /dev/null
647  |      **/
648  | 
649  |     if( sw_detach) {
650  | 	sw_verbose = 0;
651  | 	if (!ttyname(2)) {
652  | 	    int temp_fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
653  | 
654  | 	    close(2);
655  | 	    dup2(temp_fd, 2);
656  | 	}
657  |     }
658  | 
659  |     /**
660  |      **  Finally remove all options from the command line stream
661  |      **/
662  | 
663  |     c = optind - 1;
664  |     if( optind < *argc && c > 0) {
665  | 	while( optind < *argc) {
666  | 	    argv[ optind-c] = argv[ optind];
667  | 	    optind++;
668  | 	}
669  | 	*argc -= c;
670  |     }
671  | 
672  |     /**
673  |      **  Exit on success
674  |      **/
675  | 
676  |     return( TCL_OK);
677  | 
678  | } /** End of 'Check_Switches' **/
679  | 
680  | /*++++
681  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
682  |  ** 									     **
683  |  **   Function:		dup2						     **
684  |  ** 									     **
685  |  **   Description:	Duplicate file descriptor			     **
686  |  ** 									     **
687  |  **   First Edition:	1996/02/08					     **
688  |  ** 									     **
689  |  **   Parameters:	int	old		Old file descriptor	     **
690  |  **			int	new		New file descriptor	     **
691  |  **									     **
692  |  **   Result:		int	-1		any error		     **
693  |  **				other		new file descriptor	     **
694  |  ** 									     **
695  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
696  |  ++++*/
697  | 
698  | #ifndef HAVE_DUP2
699  | int dup2( int old, int new)
700  | {
701  |     int fd;
702  | 
703  |     close(new);
704  |     fd = dup(old);
705  |     if (fd != new) {
706  | 	close( fd);
707  | 	errno = EMFILE;
708  | 	fd = -1;
709  |     }
710  | 
711  |     return( fd);
712  | }
713  | #endif
714  | 
715  | /*++++
716  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
717  |  ** 									     **
718  |  **   Function:		version						     **
719  |  ** 									     **
720  |  **   Description:	Outputs the Modules version and features	     **
721  |  ** 									     **
722  |  **   First Edition:	2002/06/13					     **
723  |  ** 									     **
724  |  **   Parameters:	FILE *	output		All input is from defined    **
725  |  **						macros			     **
726  |  **   Result:		void			no return value		     **
727  |  **						All output is to output	     **
728  |  ** 									     **
729  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
730  |  ** 			version_string		Current module version	     **
731  |  ** 			date_string		Current module date	     **
732  |  **									     **
733  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
734  |  ++++*/
735  | 
736  | #define str(a) #a
737  | #define isdefined(a,b)	{if (strcmp(str(a),b)) x=str(a); else x="undef"; \
738  | 			fprintf(output,format,b,x);}
739  | 
740  | static void version (FILE *output) {
741  | 	char	*x,
742  | 		*format = "%s=%s\n";
743  | 
744  | 	fprintf(output, format, _("VERSION"), version_string);
745  | 	fprintf(output, format, _("DATE"), date_string);
746  | 	fprintf(output, "\n");
747  | 
748  | 	isdefined(AUTOLOADPATH,str(AUTOLOADPATH));
749  | 	isdefined(BASEPREFIX,str(BASEPREFIX));
750  | 	isdefined(BEGINENV,str(BEGINENV));
751  | 	isdefined(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER,str(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER));
752  | 	isdefined(DOT_EXT,str(DOT_EXT));
753  | 	isdefined(ENABLE_NLS,str(ENABLE_NLS));
754  | 	isdefined(EVAL_ALIAS,str(EVAL_ALIAS));
755  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS,str(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS));
756  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS,str(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS));
757  | 	isdefined(HAS_TCLXLIBS,str(HAS_TCLXLIBS));
758  | 	isdefined(HAS_X11LIBS,str(HAS_X11LIBS));
759  | 	isdefined(LMSPLIT_SIZE,str(LMSPLIT_SIZE));
760  | 	isdefined(MODULEPATH,str(MODULEPATH));
761  | 	isdefined(MODULES_INIT_DIR,str(MODULES_INIT_DIR));
762  | 	isdefined(PREFIX,str(PREFIX));
763  | 	isdefined(TCL_VERSION,str(TCL_VERSION));
764  | 	isdefined(TCL_PATCH_LEVEL,str(TCL_PATCH_LEVEL));
765  | 	isdefined(TMP_DIR,str(TMP_DIR));
766  | 	isdefined(USE_FREE,str(USE_FREE));
767  | 	isdefined(VERSION_MAGIC,str(VERSION_MAGIC));
768  | 	isdefined(VERSIONPATH,str(VERSIONPATH));
769  | 	isdefined(WANTS_VERSIONING,str(WANTS_VERSIONING));
770  | 
771  |   	fprintf(output, "\n");
772  | }
773  | 
774  | #undef str
775  | #undef isdefined
